question_text: Why are flash drives not considered ideal for archival storage?
answer_options: They are too large for modern devices
They require power to retain data
They have limited write endurance and are easy to lose
They are slower than mechanical hard drives
correct_answer: They have limited write endurance and are easy to lose
explanation: Flash drives use EPROM which has a finite number of write cycles, and their small size makes them prone to being lost.
